turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Hello...?

turns.speaker: ROWAN
turns.text: Michael!  Jesus  I've been trying -

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Rowan...?

turns.speaker: ROWAN
turns.text: Listen.  Last night - oh Christ, this'1l take forever to explain. God, Michael...

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: What's wrong..?

turns.speaker: ROWAN
turns.text: Michael - I have to go - to New Orleans. I'll - I'll call yati when I -

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: What about you coming down here...?

turns.speaker: ROWAN
turns.text: Go to LAX and get on a flight to New Orleans.  Go to the Ponchartrain Hotel and wait for me.  I'll call you there.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Wait a minute.  Rowan - what is going on...?

turns.speaker: ROWAN
turns.text: Goodbye, Michael.   I love you.

turns.speaker: ROWAN
turns.text: You know...?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: I know.  It's not possible --- but I know.

turns.speaker: ROWAN
turns.text: She - she said I - I was a ---

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: - a witch.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: It could've been a tornado - or a - a hurricane.  Maybe -

turns.speaker: ROWAN
turns.text: Michael - I saw him!  Twice!  Carlotta said I  ---  killed Graham - with - with my anger.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Ro - you can't really believe that. Nobody can murder someone with their feelings.  I mean --- that's CRAZY.

turns.speaker: ROWAN
turns.text: Is it more or less crazy than dying and coming back to life with hands that can see...?  God, Michael --- what am I...?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: C'mon.  Let's go to the ho---

turns.speaker: ROWAN
turns.text: He's in there!  Or are you out for a stroll in the garden ...?!  where are you, goddamnit...?!

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Even if it's all true - that doesn't make you a witch! It's 1992, Rowan!

turns.speaker: ROWAN
turns.text: But it scares the hell out of you, doesn't it. Michael...?

turns.speaker: ROWAN
turns.text: Stop looking at me like that! I'm not some siren chanting to the moon.  And my life is not a cosmic whim!  I am in charge of my life -  - and I want to stay.  Everything that was taken from me is here, Michael. All these years, she was there without me.  Helpless. I should have been here.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Rowan...   Think of what's in that book.  Think of last night!

turns.speaker: ROWAN
turns.text: I am!   And so are you.  You thought you'd found yourself a nice, sensible doctor. pause)  Michael, if you don't want -

turns.speaker: ROWAN
turns.text: Do you love me, Michael...?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Yes.  I love you.  Very much.

turns.speaker: ROWAN
turns.text: I've come home, Michae1, for the first time.  I want to stay here - with you.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: It'd take mounths... and cost a fortune.

turns.speaker: ROWAN
turns.text: I'm soon to be a very wealthy witch.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: What about your work back home...?

turns.speaker: ROWAN
turns.text: They need doctors in New Orleans too.   Michael - think what I could do with the money!

turns.speaker: ROWAN
turns.text: I'll bet she had a wonderful smile.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Let's see.

turns.speaker: ROWAN
turns.text: You sure...?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: It's the next best thing to being there' - right...?

turns.speaker: ROWAN
turns.text: Everyone - this is Michael curry.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Hello..

turns.speaker: ROWAN
turns.text: Michael - this is Beatrice Mayfair. And this is her brother, Giff---

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: I'm wondering why the hell he hasn't shown up.

turns.speaker: ROWAN
turns.text: He can't hurt us, Michael.  It's us - our love.  He can't find a crack in it.  He can't find a way in.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Maybe he's just - waiting...

turns.speaker: ROWAN
turns.text: If we married, we'd shut him out forever.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Ro, how long have we known each other.

turns.speaker: ROWAN
turns.text: I don't think of us that way - ever.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Either do I.    I love you, Ro.  You know that. You're a total mystery to me - but I love YOU.

turns.speaker: ROWAN
turns.text: Than letts get rnarried, Michael.  I could put a spell on you - and make you say yes.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: You're a ve-ry bad witch, you know that...?

turns.speaker: ROWAN
turns.text: No, I'm ve-ry good --- and you aught to know.

turns.speaker: ROWAN
turns.text: Smoking is bad for your heart, Michael.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Hey - I'm getting married in the morning - I already gave up drinking. one crutch at a time, Doctor.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: You're just afraid I'll drop dead before I finish the damn house.

turns.speaker: ROWAN
turns.text: And I thought I was the mindreader.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: I took off my gloves today - with Aaron -  - and it was okay.

turns.speaker: ROWAN
turns.text: That's GREAT!

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Guess so.    I keep thinking about the witches - when I was... down there    There was - caring.  They saved me, Ro.  They said 'go back'...  Wel1-  I came back - to you - to love you.  I like seeing it that way, y'know...?

turns.speaker: ROWAN
turns.text: Aren't we supposed to love somebody for their moral rectitude or their courage or their beneficence -

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Their what...?

turns.speaker: ROWAN
turns.text: So how come I love you most when you stick your finger in your chin...?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Wanna snack...?

turns.speaker: ROWAN
turns.text: A little wine...?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Hey - you're bleeding.

turns.speaker: ROWAN
turns.text: Dropped it.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: You look a little green.

turns.speaker: ROWAN
turns.text: Mm-hmmm...

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Maybe the shrimp you bad last night.

turns.speaker: ROWAN
turns.text: Mm-hmm...

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Gee - look at that.  I didn't know alligators came this far up on shore

turns.speaker: ROWAN
turns.text: Mm-hmm...

turns.speaker: ROWAN
turns.text: Nobody makes a car like them Nasis...

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Did you see the old man on the ---

turns.speaker: ROWAN
turns.text: Michael!

turns.speaker: ROWAN
turns.text: No - I didn't kill him.   Would you rather I'd let them kill us - after they'd raped me...?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: No.    This is unreal...

turns.speaker: ROWAN
turns.text: It's not some fairytale in an old book.    Michael - look at me.  I didn't choose this, Michael.  This is who I am.  I love you.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: I love you too.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Fall in New Orleans...  This whole town is waterlogged!  The matches, the wood, my clothes, my skin.

turns.speaker: ROWAN
turns.text: That's cause we're below sea level.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: ROWAN we're below sea level. I've spent time there myself.

turns.speaker: ROWAN
turns.text: That's not funny.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: You did that, didn't you...?

turns.speaker: ROWAN
turns.text: Talking to me dear...?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Remember the first time we made love - and then ---

turns.speaker: ROWAN
turns.text: - we made a fire.

turns.speaker: ROWAN
turns.text: Michael - what made you fall in love with me...?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Your beneficence.

turns.speaker: ROWAN
turns.text: I'm serious.    Whatever it was - it's still there inside me, isn't it - change and all...?

turns.speaker: ROWAN
turns.text: You alright...?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: A little sore.  Darm...   Finish up my section, will ya...?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Is he - is he gonna die...?

turns.speaker: ROWAN
turns.text: Lock the door.  Lock it

turns.speaker: ROWAN
turns.text: Michael - why would he want to hurt Stu...?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: If it's a boy --- Taylor.

turns.speaker: ROWAN
turns.text: A bit much.    Lucas.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Nah - I had a shmuck of an uncle named Lucas.    Grayson.

turns.speaker: ROWAN
turns.text: Where are you gitting these...?  Aaron --- if it's a boy.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: When aid you get home last night...?

turns.speaker: ROWAN
turns.text: What were you talking about...?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Yyou look terrible.  You're exhausted. You practically live at the goddamn clinic.    Even pregnant women who aren't doctors know that You can't -

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Dovetails.  Gotta be a hundred years old.

turns.speaker: ROWAN
turns.text: Go ahead.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Something's wrong with you.

turns.speaker: ROWAN
turns.text: Nothing is wrong with me.  I know something's in there - and so do you.

turns.speaker: ROWAN
turns.text: Hi.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Hi.    You - you wanna get some breakfast...?  Maybe see a movie...?

turns.speaker: ROWAN
turns.text: I - I...  I can't, Michael.  There's stuff --- at the clinic -

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Gotcha.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: You've gone away from me, Ro...  Someplace I don't know how to get to.

turns.speaker: ROWAN
turns.text: It's not true.  You have to believe me.

turns.speaker: ROWAN
turns.text: I can't.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: That's not good enough.  Why not...?!

turns.speaker: ROWAN
turns.text: I can't leave now.  Don't ask me to explain!  I just can't!

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: I've never asked you to explain yourself - because you used to let me inside!  But I'm on the outside now...  you put me there!

turns.speaker: ROWAN
turns.text: Michael - please -  just. a little longer.  Don't leave.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Why bother to ask, Ro...?  Why don't you just make me stay,..?

turns.speaker: ROWAN
turns.text: Stop it!

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: How 'bout a backward hex with a three-quarter twist...?

turns.speaker: ROWAN
turns.text: You bastard!

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: You could kill me - right now, couldn't you...?  couldn't you...?!  Tell me the truth --- is it Lasher...?  Answer me!!

turns.speaker: ROWAN
turns.text: Michael - I'm sorry...  Just give me -

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Lasher...  Where --- where is ---

turns.speaker: ROWAN
turns.text: It's alright...it's airight.  He's gone, Michael...  Gone.

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: sooner Or later you're gonna run out of things to change.  You always do.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: I just - hate it when they're - finished.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Go home, Stu  I'll call you.

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: Bullshit!  Let me in!   Mikey - there are people who can help figure this ont.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: On which planet...?

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: You can't just -

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Go away, GODDAMNIT!

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: Well, Normie - you won't have to worry about this one being finished for a lonnnnng time.  How are the hands...?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: The guy I told you about - Aaron...?  He says I can learn to control them. That I could lose the gloves at some point.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: 'Leave bees be - and the bees be nice.' Didn't your father ever teach you that...?

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: That's a wasp.  Fuckers'll sting a tree if they're bored-  so - where is she...?

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: Wow...

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: If you like that type.

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: You okay...?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Just nervous.  Getting married, you know.     Got the rings...?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: I'm getting --- left behind.

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: Left behind...?  This about Rowan...?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Yes.   Partly.  It's - it's -  Stu - do you believe in ---

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: A few hours and I'll be wasting away in Margaritaville.  Oh, sweet decadance.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Just don't fall off any ladders.

turns.speaker: ROWAN
turns.text: Rowan Mayfair.

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: Sut McKinley.  Marry me.

turns.speaker: ROWAN
turns.text: I thought you were almost engaged, Stu...?

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: You really love this guy...?

turns.speaker: ROWAN
turns.text: He's got great hands.

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: Hey - I love gloves-  I look really great in gloves.

turns.speaker: ROWAN
turns.text: I like him.  He can stay.

turns.speaker: ROWAN
turns.text: I thought it was 'whistle while you work.

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: Is that a crack about our singing...?

turns.speaker: ROWAN
turns.text: Is that what you were doing...?

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: Mikey - pregnant women get crazy you know that.  I mean - hell, they're all crazy anyway - right...?

turns.speaker: ROWAN
turns.text: Comes running out the front door - down the walk to them. MICHAEL seems to pull inside himself. Cool.  Aloof.

turns.speaker: RYAN
turns.text: We'd better get to work on the papers.

turns.speaker: ROWAN
turns.text: Papers...?

turns.speaker: RYAN
turns.text: Standard for a Mayfair marriage.  Rowan - there is a codicil concerning the Mayfair assets. They must be... aahhh... held separate from the other party... Michael  that is it's in the will - for centuries.  Tradition enjoins, Rowan.   of course, future earnings from your practice will not fall into -

turns.speaker: ROWAN
turns.text: I've decided not to open a practice here  I want to set up a research clinic.  For infant genetic disorder.

turns.speaker: RYAN
turns.text: That's new territory for us...but yes, we can look into that.  Explore shelter possibilities, funding bodies. we could -

turns.speaker: ROWAN
turns.text: No tax shelters.  No funding.  I want to fund the clinic - exclusively.  The Diedre Mayfair Research Clinic.  I'd like to find an existing building and move in immediately - while we draw up plans for new construction.

turns.speaker: RYAN
turns.text: That would mean liquidating sizable amounts of cash.

turns.speaker: ROWAN
turns.text: I plan on liquidating almost evetything.

turns.speaker: DEZERAE
turns.text: Which do you think is her best shot...

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: The one on the left - definitely...

turns.speaker: DEZERAE
turns.text: Don't give me shit - what do you want?

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: I've got a tenant coming over later - can I take the afternoon off?

turns.speaker: DEZERAE
turns.text: As long as you get the HACKSAW piece done by FRIDAY... FRIDAY?

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: That's not technically accurate - SIMPSONS murders weren't sexually motivated.

turns.speaker: DEZERAE
turns.text: You know that circulation is down for three months in a row.

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: I heard something like that

turns.speaker: DEZERAE
turns.text: Then it's going to be 'I killed for sex'... Listen darling, why won't you let us use your real name for the features - if people knew that it was the ELLEN CARTER writing the features and not just some pseudonym - then we might shift more units. You haven't written anything in four years darling - I know you need this job - and if circulation keeps dropping, there's not going to be a magazine for you to write for...

turns.speaker: DEZERAE
turns.text: OH MY GAWD!

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: I'm sorry - I didn't think

turns.speaker: DEZERAE
turns.text: A person could get killed round here just for working late

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: I thought you were someone else

turns.speaker: DEZERAE
turns.text: Well I'm glad I'm not them - what are you doing here so late? Come to that, what the hell have you got that for?

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: I thought someone was following me - I - er -  I just needed my computer and some things...Listen, I'd like to work from home for a few weeks - is that OK?

turns.speaker: DEZERAE
turns.text: Why don't you take a few weeks off - you're due some holiday time.

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: Sounds good - thank you

turns.speaker: DEZERAE
turns.text: Don't mention it - now can I get back to my accounts, or do you want to fillet me?

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: You see, I am writing this article for CHIC MAGAZINE

turns.speaker: MANAGER
turns.text: CHIC MAGAZINE?

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: Yes - it's about bank safety deposit boxes - I wonder if you might just explain how they work - and maybe even show me round.

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: When could I look round?

turns.speaker: MANAGER
turns.text: Well, if you could come sometime just before we close, then I could show you everything and  then we could go for a drink to discuss the finer points...

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: That's very kind of you MR GRIFFITHS...?

turns.speaker: MANAGER
turns.text: BRIAN...

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: But - If you could show me round now - and I'll meet you later?

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: Its cramped in here isn't it BRIAN

turns.speaker: MANAGER
turns.text: Yes it is...

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: Tell me BRIAN, what would happen if the client lost the key?

turns.speaker: MANAGER
turns.text: Then we would have to call in our locksmith to break the lock

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: So there is only one key...

turns.speaker: MANAGER
turns.text: That's right...

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: And it can't be forged?

turns.speaker: MANAGER
turns.text: I didn't say that - I'm sure it could be, but our clients must sign in first, checking signatures, and a photo ident - we had a nasty theft two years ago and we've been very strict since then.

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: Yes, I'm sure you could - but I can't risk you loosing your job

turns.speaker: MANAGER
turns.text: No -it's no problem - I do it all the time

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: All the time?

turns.speaker: MANAGER
turns.text: No - not all the time - I mean

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: I know what you mean - I'll meet you at VINNIES WINE BAR at six if you like. And don't make any plans for this evening...

turns.speaker: MANAGER
turns.text: Hello MRS STECKLER - we haven't seen you for a long time

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: No - I've been abroad for a long time...

turns.speaker: MANAGER
turns.text: I shouldn't say this - but you really remind me of someone I know

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: Oh really - you must remember me from when I was a regular customer.

turns.speaker: MANAGER
turns.text: I wasn't a manager here then MRS STECKLER - don't you remember?

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: I'm terribly sorry - I have a bad memory...

turns.speaker: MANAGER
turns.text: This must be one of the old keys -

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: Yes - I have had it for years.

turns.speaker: STECKLER
turns.text: It doesn't mention 'females only'

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: I really don't know what to say

turns.speaker: STECKLER
turns.text: Oh - Tell me ELLEN, I can call you ELLEN?

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: Sure...

turns.speaker: STECKLER
turns.text: Tell me - ELLEN CARTER  Forgive me for being so pushy, but aren't you a novelist? Didn't you write that terrific book - 'The Color of Fear'?

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: I lost the touch

turns.speaker: STECKLER
turns.text: The touch?

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: Do you take sugar?

turns.speaker: STECKLER
turns.text: Yes, two please. I'm sorry, I didn't mean to pry, it's just that I really loved your book

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: What are you doing?

turns.speaker: STECKLER
turns.text: I'm sorry?

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: What's with all the locks - and hammering

turns.speaker: STECKLER
turns.text: It says in the contract I can have a lock fitted - is there a problem ANGELA?

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: My names isn't ANGELA...

turns.speaker: STECKLER
turns.text: Yes - I'm sorry ELLEN...

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: Don't worry - Is that my hammer  Well Just make sure that it's put back in the garage...

turns.speaker: STECKLER
turns.text: If you want any - there's some left in the kitchen

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: I think I will pass...

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: Sugar?

turns.speaker: STECKLER
turns.text: Yes, one and a half please.

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: So what do you do?

turns.speaker: STECKLER
turns.text: I'm a dentist

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: And how long have you been a dentist?

turns.speaker: STECKLER
turns.text: Oh, about six years since I graduated

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: And how many people have you killed?

turns.speaker: STECKLER
turns.text: I don't know

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: You don't know?

turns.speaker: STECKLER
turns.text: No - the police say I've killed fourteen - but I've not - I've killed many more. It amazes me how they just haven't found the bodies. What is society coming to when people just don't get missed. I agree, some of them are well hidden - I probably couldn't even show you where I put them - one girl, number eight I think the press called it - she wasn't even mine - I don't know who did it but I didn't

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: Where do you kill them...

turns.speaker: STECKLER
turns.text: Oh anywhere - whenever I needed to - Do you know how easy it is to take them? You just pick up a hiker, or someone off the streets - they believe so easily you know, 'Look, I have something to show you' I would say - and that would be it. One girl, I think her name is Debbie - she had broken down on the motorway, and I offered to take her to a service station to call for a tow truck - She just got in and I drove away. When I pulled into the layby and took out my knife - she just froze, and said - what do you want? - I said, You know what I want. - But she didn't. Getting rid of the bodies is just as easy - the first I cut up, put in bags with bricks in, and tossed them off Eldridge Bridge in broad daylight.  The real problem with my work is the blood - there is so much of it - and it all spurts out so fast - like a fountain. It made such a mess of

turns.speaker: STECKLER
turns.text: my car  I stopped working from my car.  She could have stopped me you know - If she really wanted too. That is the difference between the confusion of humanity and the purity of the beast - If a dog attacked you - you could easily kill it without any damage to yourself - Why then do people get bitten by dogs - savaged? Why?

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: I don't know

turns.speaker: STECKLER
turns.text: Because a dog will attack with a ferocity and force that we poses, but centuries of social contamination has run it out of us - that is what sets us aside from the purity of the beasts...Society is rotting - men who once were strong and kept everything working are getting soft - women are making them soft - by the time a pretty girl has reached twenty - she has had three lifetimes worth of fun and attention- so she doesn't deserve any more -

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: Didn't DEBBIE deserve anymore?

turns.speaker: STECKLER
turns.text: No she didn't...

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: What did you do with her?

turns.speaker: STECKLER
turns.text: You know everyone accuses me of being sick - the press, the TV - but I'm not you know - they are - I don't watch it for entertainment every night - I don't sit and watch it whilst eating my dinner - they all say, how could he cut her up? She was dead - I can't hurt something dead - And all this whilst they slobber down their processed beef burgers by the dozen - I couldn't eat one of those burgers, you don't know what has gone in them!

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: The press think that the WHITE ANGEL is a woman - why is that? Do you dress up LESLIE?

turns.speaker: STECKLER
turns.text: I don't want to talk about it -

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: OK, the press call you the WHITE ANGLE because you only kill girls wearing white - why white - white clothes, blonde hair...

turns.speaker: STECKLER
turns.text: I don't know...

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: Is 'their' colour an expression of their inner self? By that I mean, extroverts wear bright colours - so what are people who wear white?

turns.speaker: STECKLER
turns.text: I don't know...

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: Is white an expression of innocence? Do you crave innocence LESLIE?

turns.speaker: STECKLER
turns.text: Let me ask you, why do you wear black ELLEN CARTER? What are you running from?

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: Do you feel sorry for the girls you have killed

turns.speaker: STECKLER
turns.text: Why should I feel sorry - they're dead.

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: How long have you been watching me?

turns.speaker: STECKLER
turns.text: I have something I have to show you...

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: Tell me about your wife...

turns.speaker: STECKLER
turns.text: My wife  My wife was the only one who really deserved it.  LESLIE do this. LESLIE do that. LESLIE it's your fault... She used to tell me what to wear, where to go, what to do - she mothered me...

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: then why did you marry her -

turns.speaker: STECKLER
turns.text: It seemed like a good idea at the time - why did you marry your husband.

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: What didn't you like about her?

turns.speaker: STECKLER
turns.text: I hated being treated like a failure - looked down on - my sister used to do that - I hated it - I should have known, when we got married - in a registry office of course - she wore maroon - I just wanted a white wedding  I think she thought I was a ticket to the good life. I had a good job, prospects. And she was a slut - I didn't know until too late. One day, I came

turns.speaker: STECKLER
turns.text: You are the first person I have ever told any of this to. We are birds of a feather ELLEN...we're in the same league

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: I don't think so...This isn't a game you know...There aren't points or leagues. Sure I killed my husband - but I am no killer.

turns.speaker: STECKLER
turns.text: You've killed but you're not a killer

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: That's right...Don't ever think that you and I are the same - we're not even remotely similar. I did what I had to do for myself, for my own self preservation - not to live out some bizarre role playing fantasy. My husband was sick -

turns.speaker: STECKLER
turns.text: Tell me how it happened...

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: Why should I?

turns.speaker: STECKLER
turns.text: Why not? Please - it would help me

turns.speaker: STECKLER
turns.text: And how did it feel to be rid of him

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: Wonderful - like a great release - He was a malignant cancer and I had to remove him - the world is better without him

turns.speaker: STECKLER
turns.text: My mother...?  I never knew my real MOTHER - I was adopted

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: Tell me about your adopted MOTHER

turns.speaker: STECKLER
turns.text: You think I killed my MOTHER don't you?

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: Did you?

turns.speaker: STECKLER
turns.text: No...I didn't do it...I wish I had but I didn't. I was beaten to it. STEPHANIE became my mother.

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: STEPHANIE?

turns.speaker: STECKLER
turns.text: My sister - My ADOPTED SISTER -

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: Did STEPHANIE kill your MOTHER?

turns.speaker: STECKLER
turns.text: STEPHANIE loved me - she got some insurance money and took legal custody of me - she was just old enough. We had a ball for years - we could do anything, anywhere, anyhow...And we did...We would play games - she would be the executioner and I would be the convict - She would strap me into the arm chair and pretend to electrocute me...

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: What was your relationship with STEPHANIE?

turns.speaker: STECKLER
turns.text: It was wrong - all my life I have been cheated - cheated of anything good - I shouldn't have been born - I was a mistake - my natural mother was a whore - that makes me...

turns.speaker: STECKLER
turns.text: I want it to stop - it all to stop...

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: Then make it stop...

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: STECKLER
turns.text: I know this sounds insane ELLEN, but... Telling you all of this, writing the book... It feels good. Don't get me wrong - I feel like a weight is being lifted from my shoulders... When I tell you what I have done - I can't believe it is me...Yet I know it was. This is like a purging for me...

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: Psychiatrists would say that you are confronting your demons

turns.speaker: STECKLER
turns.text: Demons... This wouldn't have been possible without you... You have given me incentive ELLEN - I can see clearer now...

turns.speaker: STECKLER
turns.text: What's wrong?

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: Nothing could be better...

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: What's wrong?

turns.speaker: STECKLER
turns.text: I am ashamed of what I have done ELLEN. When I read what you had written it made me think - look into myself - I haven't dared look into myself for a long time - I have stopped ELLEN, I can't carry on - I won't carry on. All I want is to start a new life - I want a second chance...You are good to me - you don't condescend, you're intelligent, and very beautiful...

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: What is it?

turns.speaker: STECKLER
turns.text: Open it...
